metadata.title: CVE-2019-12749 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
dbus before 1.10.28, 1.12.x before 1.12.16, and 1.13.x before 1.13.12, asused in DBusServer in Canonical Upstart in Ubuntu 14.04 (and in some, lesscommon, uses of dbus-daemon), allows cookie spoofing because of symlinkmishandling in the reference implementation of DBUS_COOKIE_SHA1 in thelibdbus library. (This only affects the DBUS_COOKIE_SHA1 authenticationmechanism.) A malicious client with write access to its own home directorycould manipulate a ~/.dbus-keyrings symlink to cause a DBusServer with adifferent uid to read and write in unintended locations. In the worst case,this could result in the DBusServer reusing a cookie that is known to themalicious client, and treating that cookie as evidence that a subsequentclient connection came from an attacker-chosen uid, allowing authenticationbypass.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dbus - 1.12.2-1ubuntu1.1
dbus-tests - 1.12.2-1ubuntu1.1
dbus-user-session - 1.12.2-1ubuntu1.1
dbus-x11 - 1.12.2-1ubuntu1.1
libdbus-1-3 - 1.12.2-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dbus package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.2-1ubuntu1.1').
